text:
I have purchased from Bangalore last month.

All are sharing positive info. So not covering all positives

Pls find only cons

1) front side suspension is very hard. You can find vibration in your hands heavily 

2) front side box lock quality is very bad

3) display battery and KM value is not exactly match. Some issues are there is software 

4) reverse mode switch is bid hard.

5) mirrors are very small. Not visible to backside vehicles 

6) if you park is slope area , there is no hill hold assistant... We need to press the brake always.. we always find up and slope roads... Not sure on Chennai roads..
7) ride mode - max 85 km range only..

8) extra 2 years warranty - 6k to be paid

9) many of the accessories are not available - out of stock always
author: @sreenid5517

text: River Indie is a good scooter, but its charger is a weak point ‚Äî in fact, almost all EV companies in India are coming up with their own different charging ports, which is one of the biggest reasons why people hesitate to buy EVs. Just like how all mobile phones now use a universal Type-C cable, EVs should also have a universal charging port so that any vehicle can be charged at any company's charging station.

text:
I have been using it for past 1 month. The scooter has very good suspensions, headlights are improved now, and offers a really well balanced ride. Range is also satisfactory, but could have been better, considering it has 4kwh battery.
However my biggest gripe with this vehicle is that below 15% the performance of it in in default eco mode is simply pathetic. It fails to even go 30-35km/h speed in that battery mode. Also River now needs to go to other parts of India as well, including northern or east India, otherwise such a good scooter wont be accepted nationwide or get the required publicity.
